intro: Allosorus × ibericus, commonly known as the Iberian alpine bellflower, is a hybrid plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
